programme.title: Margaret, (2011, Drama)
programme.desc: Feeling responsible for a fatal traffic accident, a high-school student lashes out when her attempts to make amends meet with opposition.

programme.title: Good Hair, (2009, Documentary)
programme.desc: Comic Chris Rock explores how hairstyles affect the self-esteem, activities and relationships of African-Americans.

programme.title: Low Tide, (2019, Drama)
programme.desc: When teenager Alan and his younger brother find a bag of gold coins in a dead man's island home, they try to hide it from their friends -- but one of them, suspicious and violently unpredictable, is willing to do anything to get the money.

programme.title: Balls Out, (2014, Comedy)
programme.desc: Fifth year college senior Caleb Fuller (Jake Lacy) gets his flag football team back together for one last shot at intramural football glory.

programme.title: Lady Bird, (2017, Comedy)
programme.desc: A teenager (Saoirse Ronan) navigates a loving but turbulent relationship with her strong-willed mother (Laurie Metcalf) over the course of an eventful and poignant senior year of high school.

programme.title: The 9th Life of Louis Drax, (2016, Thriller)
programme.desc: An acclaimed neurologist (Jamie Dornan) taps into the unconscious mind of a 9-year-old boy (Aiden Longworth) who has survived nine near-death accidents.

programme.title: The Assistant, (2020, Thriller)
programme.desc: Digital assistants are programmed to help people. However, when one such bot goes rogue, it ends up becoming a nightmare for its owner, who is stepping into new beginnings.

programme.title: House of 1000 Corpses, (2003, Horror)
programme.desc: Four travelers take refuge in the home of a clan of demented killers. Written and directed by musician Rob Zombie.

programme.title: Nine Lives, (2016, Comedy)
programme.desc: A workaholic billionaire (Kevin Spacey) tries to communicate with his family when a bizarre turn of events traps him inside the body of a cat named Mr. Fuzzypants.

programme.title: Keeping Up With the Joneses, (2016, Comedy)
programme.desc: An ordinary suburban couple (Zach Galifianakis, Isla Fisher) discover it's not easy keeping up with their gorgeous and ultra-sophisticated new neighbors, the Joneses, especially when they discover that Mr. and Mrs. Jones are really covert operatives.

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War, (2016, Fantasy)
programme.desc: A huntsman (Chris Hemsworth) and a fellow warrior (Jessica Chastain) battle an ice queen (Emily Blunt) and her evil, resurrected sister (Charlize Theron).

programme.title: House Party, (2023, Comedy)
programme.desc: Aspiring club promoters and best buds Damon and Kevin need a huge windfall to make their problems go away. They decide to host the party of the year at an exclusive mansion, which just happens to belong to none other than NBA superstar LeBron James.

programme.title: Spaceship Earth, (2020, Documentary)
programme.desc: In 1991 eight visionaries embark on a two-year experiment to quarantine themselves inside Biosphere 2 -- a self-engineered replica of Earth's ecosystem.

programme.title: Good Time, (2017, Thriller)
programme.desc: A bank robber stops at nothing to free his brother from prison, launching himself into a nightlong odyssey through New York's dark and dangerous criminal underworld.

programme.title: Four Christmases, (2008, Christmas)
programme.desc: When their plans for a holiday getaway fall apart, a couple (Vince Vaughn, Reese Witherspoon) must spend Christmas Day trudging to a quartet of family get-togethers.

programme.title: Kicks, (2016, Comedy)
programme.desc: A 15-year-old (Jahking Guillory) recruits his two best friends (Christopher Meyer, Christopher Jordan Wallace) to help him retrieve his stolen Air Jordan sneakers from a neighborhood thug (Kofi Siriboe).

programme.title: Wilson, (2017, Comedy)
programme.desc: After reuniting with his ex-wife (Laura Dern), a lonely and neurotic misanthrope (Woody Harrelson) tries to form a connection with the teenage daughter (Isabella Amara) he never knew he had.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie, (2016, Comedy)
programme.desc: London publicist Edina Monsoon and best friend Patsy Stone flee to the French Riviera after accidentally knocking supermodel Kate Moss into the River Thames.

programme.title: Low Tide, (2019, Drama)
programme.desc: When teenager Alan and his younger brother find a bag of gold coins in a dead man's island home, they try to hide it from their friends -- but one of them, suspicious and violently unpredictable, is willing to do anything to get the money.

programme.title: It Comes at Night, (2017, Horror)
programme.desc: After a mysterious apocalypse leaves the world with few survivors, two families are forced to share a home in an uneasy alliance to keep the outside evil at bay -- only to learn that the true horror may come from within.

programme.title: House of 1000 Corpses, (2003, Horror)
programme.desc: Four travelers take refuge in the home of a clan of demented killers. Written and directed by musician Rob Zombie.

programme.title: Cut Bank, (2014, Thriller)
programme.desc: Things go from bad to worse when a murder witness (Liam Hemsworth) in small-town Montana tries to leverage the crime into a get-rich-quick scheme.

programme.title: Problemista, (2023, Comedy)
programme.desc: Alejandro, an aspiring toy designer from El Salvador, tries to bring his fanciful ideas to life and chase his dream in New York City with the help of his erratic employer.

programme.title: Tell, (2014, Action)
programme.desc: A small-time thief (Milo Ventimiglia) makes a big score and tries to keep it from his ex-partner, his ex-wife and other greedy sorts.

programme.title: Confidence, (2003, Crime Story)
programme.desc: A con man (Edward Burns) and his crew swindle a gangster's accountant, then try to repay him by stealing from a crooked banker.

programme.title: Godzilla vs. Mechagodzilla, (1974, Science fiction)
programme.desc: An Okinawan monster-god helps Godzilla defeat his bionic double.

programme.title: Independence Day: Resurgence, (2016, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Using recovered extraterrestrial technology, the nations of Earth collaborate on an immense defense program to protect the planet. When the aliens attack with unprecedented force, only the ingenuity of a few brave men and women can save the world.

programme.title: D...: The Musical, (2023, Musical)
programme.desc: Two self-obsessed businessmen discover they're long-lost identical twins and come together to plot the reunion of their divorced parents.

programme.title: Home Again, (2017, Romance)
programme.desc: Separated from her husband, Alice lets three young men -- Harry, George and Teddy -- stay in her guesthouse. As Alice develops a budding romance with Harry, her newfound happiness comes crashing down when her ex shows up with a suitcase in his hand.

programme.title: The Color Purple, (2023, Musical)
programme.desc: Torn apart from her sister and her children, Celie faces many hardships, including an abusive husband. With support from a singer and her stepdaughter, she ultimately finds extraordinary strength in the unbreakable bonds of a new kind of sisterhood.

programme.title: Invictus, (2009, Drama)
programme.desc: Following the fall of apartheid, Nelson Mandela (Morgan Freeman) tries to unite his countrymen by supporting the South African rugby team's underdog bid for the 1995 World Cup Championship.

programme.title: Gifted, (2017, Drama)
programme.desc: A man (Chris Evans) wages a legal battle against his mother (Lindsay Duncan) for custody of his orphaned niece (Mckenna Grace), a young mathematics prodigy who wants to live with him.

programme.title: Gloria Bell, (2018, Romance)
programme.desc: A free-spirited divorcee spends her nights on the dance floor, joyfully letting loose at clubs around Los Angeles. She soon finds herself thrust into an unexpected new romance, filled with the joys of budding love and the complications of dating.

programme.title: It Follows, (2014, Horror)
programme.desc: Following a strange sexual encounter, a teenager (Maika Monroe) has disturbing visions and the inescapable feeling that someone -- or something -- is stalking her.

programme.title: State of Play, (2009, Thriller)
programme.desc: An investigative journalist (Russell Crowe) stumbles into a cover-up of gigantic proportions as he and his partner probe the murder of a beloved congressman's (Ben Affleck) mistress.

programme.title: Sergio Leone: The Italian Who Invented America, (2022, Documentary)
programme.desc: An homage to Italian film director Sergio Leone, credited as the pioneer of the spaghetti western subgenre, featuring interviews with Quentin Tarantino, Robert De Niro and Clint Eastwood.

programme.title: The Lovers, (2017, Romance)
programme.desc: A man and his wife, each embroiled in an extramarital affair, are sent reeling when they suddenly fall for the least likely person imaginable -- each other.

programme.title: Veronica Mars, (2014, Mystery)
programme.desc: On the eve of her law-school graduation, Veronica turns amateur sleuth once again after ex-boyfriend, Logan, becomes a murder suspect.

programme.title: It Comes at Night, (2017, Horror)
programme.desc: After a mysterious apocalypse leaves the world with few survivors, two families are forced to share a home in an uneasy alliance to keep the outside evil at bay -- only to learn that the true horror may come from within.

programme.title: The Martian, (2015, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Left behind by his crew, a stranded astronaut must find a way to survive on Mars, while NASA and a team of international scientists work tirelessly to bring him home.

programme.title: Eye in the Sky, (2015, Thriller)
programme.desc: A lieutenant general (Alan Rickman) and a colonel (Helen Mirren) face political opposition after ordering a drone missile strike to take out a group of suicide bombers in Nairobi, Kenya.

programme.title: The Devil's Rejects, (2005, Horror)
programme.desc: A vengeful sheriff and two bounty hunters track a murderous family (Sid Haig, Bill Moseley, Sheri Moon Zombie) on the run.

programme.title: Sixteen Candles, (1984, Comedy)
programme.desc: A girl turning 16 likes another girl's guy (Michael Schoeffling) and feels nobody cares about her birthday.

programme.title: American Ultra, (2015, Action)
programme.desc: When his secret past comes back to haunt him, a small-town stoner (Jesse Eisenberg) must use his latent, deadly skills to prevent the CIA from taking him out.

programme.title: Scream, (1996, Horror)
programme.desc: A psycho killer targets a past victim's daughter (Neve Campbell), while a tabloid TV reporter (Courteney Cox) homes in on his identity.

programme.title: The Boss, (2016, Comedy)
programme.desc: After her release from prison, a former CEO (Melissa McCarthy) battles old enemies while trying to build a brownie empire with her ex-assistant (Kristen Bell).

programme.title: The Iron Claw, (2023, Biography)
programme.desc: The true story of the Von Erich brothers, who, through tragedy and triumph, under the shadow of their domineering father and coach, seek epic immortality on the biggest stage in sports.

programme.title: 3 From Hell, (2019, Horror)
programme.desc: Crazed killers Baby Firefly, Captain Spaulding and Otis Driftwood unleash bloody mayhem after escaping from prison.

programme.title: The Killing of a Sacred Deer, (2017, Thriller)
programme.desc: A fatherless teen starts to insinuate himself into the life of a renowned surgeon, his wife and two children. The full scope of his intent soon becomes menacingly clear when he confronts the doctor with a long-forgotten transgression.

programme.title: Black Adam, (2022, Action)
programme.desc: Bestowed with the almighty powers of the gods, Black Adam's unique form of justice, born out of rage, is challenged by modern-day heroes who form the Justice Society: Hawkman, Dr. Fate, Atom Smasher and Cyclone.

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan, (2016, Adventure)
programme.desc: Lured from Victorian England to the wilds of the Congo, Tarzan (Alexander Skarsg√•rd) must return to the jungle to save his captive wife (Margot Robbie) from King Leopold's devious envoy (Christoph Waltz).

programme.title: The Huntsman: Winter's War, (2016, Fantasy)
programme.desc: A huntsman (Chris Hemsworth) and a fellow warrior (Jessica Chastain) battle an ice queen (Emily Blunt) and her evil, resurrected sister (Charlize Theron).

programme.title: The Lighthouse, (2019, Thriller)
programme.desc: Two lighthouse keepers try to maintain their sanity while living on a remote and mysterious New England island in the 1890s.

programme.title: House Party, (2023, Comedy)
programme.desc: Aspiring club promoters and best buds Damon and Kevin need a huge windfall to make their problems go away. They decide to host the party of the year at an exclusive mansion, which just happens to belong to none other than NBA superstar LeBron James.

programme.title: Good Time, (2017, Thriller)
programme.desc: A bank robber stops at nothing to free his brother from prison, launching himself into a nightlong odyssey through New York's dark and dangerous criminal underworld.

programme.title: Gloria Bell, (2018, Romance)
programme.desc: A free-spirited divorcee spends her nights on the dance floor, joyfully letting loose at clubs around Los Angeles. She soon finds herself thrust into an unexpected new romance, filled with the joys of budding love and the complications of dating.

programme.title: Amistad, (1997, History)
programme.desc: U.S. lawyers (Anthony Hopkins, Matthew McConaughey) defend Africans who revolted against their Spanish captors aboard a slave ship in 1839.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: Luke Ellis wakes up at The Institute, a facility that abducts teenagers with psychic powers; Ms. Sigsby, the place's charismatic director, claims they're saving the world; Tim Jamieson hides from his haunted past as a small-town night knocker.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: Luke bonds with the other Front Half residents and begins plotting his escape; Ms. Sigsby manages the fallout from a security breach; in town, Tim begins to look into The Institute, only to find himself caught up in a high-stakes standoff.

programme.title: Transformers One, (2024, Animated)
programme.desc: Brothers-in-arms Orion Pax and D-16 become sworn enemies Optimus Prime and Megatron.

programme.title: The Aviator, (2004, History)
programme.desc: During the 1930s and '40s, wealthy industrialist Howard Hughes (Leonardo DiCaprio) gains fame as a movie producer, airplane designer and pilot.

programme.title: Novocaine, (2025, Action)
programme.desc: When the girl of his dreams gets kidnapped, a man turns his inability to feel pain into an unexpected advantage. He fights a bunch of thugs to get her back.

programme.title: xXx: Return of Xander Cage, (2017, Action)
programme.desc: Daredevil operative Xander Cage (Vin Diesel) springs into action when four dangerous criminals steal Pandora's Box, a device that controls every military satellite in the world.

programme.title: Star Trek, (2009, Science fiction)
programme.desc: Young James T. Kirk (Chris Pine), Spock (Zachary Quinto) and the rest of the Enterprise crew embark on a collision course with a vengeful Romulan.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: Luke begins to plan his escape while Sigsby is distracted trying to expose Stackhouse's disloyalty; Tim loses a friend.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: Luke begins to plan his escape while Sigsby is distracted trying to expose Stackhouse's disloyalty; Tim loses a friend.

programme.title: Interstellar, (2014, Science fiction)
programme.desc: As mankind's time on Earth comes to an end, a group of explorers (Matthew McConaughey, Anne Hathaway) begins the most important mission in human history: traveling beyond the galaxy to discover if there is a future for man among the stars.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: Luke begins to plan his escape while Sigsby is distracted trying to expose Stackhouse's disloyalty; Tim loses a friend.

programme.title: Downhill Racer, (1969, Drama)
programme.desc: A cocky American (Robert Redford) skis and apres-skis Europe, training with his coach (Gene Hackman) for the Olympics.

programme.title: Valley Girl, (2020, Musical)
programme.desc: A valley girl and a punk rocker from the city defy their parents and friends to stay together.

programme.title: Sky Captain and the World of Tomorrow, (2004, Adventure)
programme.desc: A daredevil aviator (Jude Law) and an ace reporter (Gwyneth Paltrow) fight an evil mastermind and his army of gigantic robots.

programme.title: Outlaws and Angels, (2016, Western)
programme.desc: In 1887, three violent fugitives hold a couple and their children (Francesca Eastwood, Madisen Beaty) hostage in their isolated New Mexico farmhouse.

programme.title: Everybody Wants Some!!, (2016, Comedy)
programme.desc: In 1980 Texas, a college freshman (Blake Jenner) meets his new baseball teammates (Will Brittain, Ryan Guzman), an unruly group of disco-dancing, skirt-chasing partyers.

programme.title: Whiskey Tango Foxtrot, (2016, War)
programme.desc: In 2002, cable news producer Kim Barker shakes up her routine by covering the war in Kabul, Afghanistan.

programme.title: Kate & Leopold, (2001, Fantasy)
programme.desc: A Manhattan woman (Meg Ryan) falls in love with the 19th-century Duke of Albany (Hugh Jackman) who has stepped through a time portal.

programme.title: American Fiction, (2023, Comedy)
programme.desc: Fed up with the establishment that profits from Black entertainment that relies on tired and offensive tropes, a frustrated novelist writes an outlandish book of his own that propels him to the heart of hypocrisy and the madness he claims to disdain.

programme.title: Waiting to Exhale, (1995, Romance)
programme.desc: Relationships preoccupy Phoenix friends: divorcee Bernadine (Angela Bassett), careerist Savannah (Whitney Houston), popular Robin (Lela Rochon), and Gloria, whose ex-husband is gay.

programme.title: The Institute
programme.desc: Luke begins to plan his escape while Sigsby is distracted trying to expose Stackhouse's disloyalty; Tim loses a friend.

programme.title: Nine Bodies in a Mexican Morgue
programme.desc: The survivors work out how to call for help, but are faced with a treacherous climb; as some of the group begin to crack under the pressure, a third death warns that they are running out of time.

programme.title: Nine Bodies in a Mexican Morgue
programme.desc: The deadly secret hidden in Flight CBZ517 is discovered, but it still doesn't explain the murders or help the survivors escape; the passengers believe they have found the traitor in the group.

programme.title: Fargo, (1996, Thriller)
programme.desc: A pregnant police chief (Frances McDormand) probes the murderous events that evolved from a desperate car salesman's (William H. Macy) kidnapping scheme.

programme.title: LaRoy, Texas, (2023, Comedy)
programme.desc: Mistaken for a low-rent hit man, Ray decides to play the part of a hired gun. However, when the supposedly simple plan begins to unravel, he recruits a private investigator to help him escape from the actual killer and make it out alive.

programme.title: The Parallax View, (1974, Thriller)
programme.desc: A reporter's investigation into a political assassination reveals a nationwide network of trained killers.

programme.title: A Shot in the Dark, (1964, Comedy)
programme.desc: Clumsy Inspector Clouseau (Peter Sellers) visits a nudist camp to prove a French maid (Elke Sommer) innocent of murder.

programme.title: Unprotected Sets
programme.desc: There is more than meets the eye with Alabama native Rocky Dale Davis; people are quick to misjudge him as a typical Southern white boy, but Rocky has a progressive outlook in his comedy.

programme.title: The Manchurian Candidate, (1962, Thriller)
programme.desc: A Korean War hero's (Laurence Harvey) commanding officer (Frank Sinatra) discovers he and his platoon were brainwashed.

programme.title: Diablo, (2015, Western)
programme.desc: A young Civil War veteran (Scott Eastwood) embarks on a quest to save his kidnapped wife (Camilla Belle) from a band of ruthless Mexican bandits.

programme.title: The Prize Winner of Defiance, Ohio, (2005, Drama)
programme.desc: A '50s-era housewife (Julianne Moore) uses her wit and winnings from commercial jingle contests to help support her large family.

programme.title: Heaven's Gate, (1980, Western)
programme.desc: A well-educated marshal defends immigrant settlers against cattle barons in 1890s Johnson County, Wyoming.

programme.title: Mr. & Mrs. Bridge, (1990, Drama)
programme.desc: A rich Midwestern lawyer (Paul Newman), his wife (Joanne Woodward) and their children grow apart in the World War II era.

programme.title: The Fire Inside, (2024, Drama)
programme.desc: The story of Claressa "T-Rex" Shields, a boxer from Flint, Mich., who trained to become the first woman in her country's history to win an Olympic gold medal in the sport.

programme.title: The Boys in the Boat, (2023, Drama)

programme.title: Hollywood Homicide, (2003, Action Comedies)
programme.desc: A pair of detectives investigate a murder while pursuing their other full-time professions. Welcome to Hollywood Homicide - the only place where you can come to work hungry, horny, thirsty, and broke, and resolve all four by the end of the watch.

programme.title: Drive, (2011, Thriller)
programme.desc: A Hollywood stunt performer (Ryan Gosling) who moonlights as a wheelman discovers that a contract has been put on him after a heist gone wrong.

programme.title: Revolver, (2005, Action)
programme.desc: REVOLVER is populated with Guy Ritchie's (Snatch; Lock, Stock & Two Smoking Barrels) classic breed of fast-talking, sharp-suited gangsters but with a psychological twist that your mind may not be able to handle.

programme.title: Enough, (2002, Drama)
programme.desc: An abused wife on the run from her violent husband finally decides she's had enough.

programme.title: Lethal Weapon, (1987, Action)
programme.desc: Mel Gibson stars as a Los Angeles policeman who recently lost his wife and has been acting increasingly unstable. Danny Glover plays a homicide detective with an impeccable record and a loving family. Now the two are stuck with each other as partners.

programme.title: Lethal Weapon 2, (1989, Action)
programme.desc: Mel Gibson and Danny Glover are back as a volatile pair of LAPD detectives. This time, the cops are unhappy with their assignment to baby-sit an accountant. But the mob wants the accountant dead‚Äîand is killing everyone who gets in its way.

programme.title: Lethal Weapon 3, (1992, Action)
programme.desc: Police officers Riggs (Mel Gibson) and Murtaugh (Danny Glover) team for the third time. This time, they must track down a crooked cop who has stolen weapons from the Los Angeles police depot.

programme.title: Lethal Weapon 4, (1998, Action)
programme.desc: Mel Gibson and Danny Glover reteam as a pair of Los Angeles police detectives. Promoted to desk jobs to keep them out of trouble, the two cops join forces with a junior detective and a fast-talking private investigator to unravel a series of crimes.

programme.title: Real Life, (1979, Mockumentaries)
programme.desc: In his directorial debut. Brooks presents a hilarious account of what happens to a typical American family when a group of filmmakers moves in with them to record "real life."

programme.title: Lost In America, (2019, Documentary)
programme.desc: The world's wealthiest country has 4.2 million homeless teenagers. Director Rotimi Rainwater along with the help of celebrities and politicians who have been homeless themselves, take a large scale issue down to a very personal level.

programme.title: When We Were Kings, (1997, Documentary)
programme.desc: A documentary of the 1974 heavyweight championship bout in Zaire, 'The Rumble in the Jungle,' between champion George Foreman and underdog challenger Muhammad Ali.

programme.title: Hoop Dreams, (1994, Documentary)
programme.desc: A film following the lives of two inner-city Chicago boys who struggle to become college basketball players on the road to going professional.

programme.title: Air Guitar Nation (2012), (2006, Documentary)
programme.desc: In this documentary from filmmaker Alexandra Lipsitz, the cameras roll to capture the fierce competitive spirit that defined the first annual U.S. Air Guitar Championship.

programme.title: When We Were Kings, (1997, Documentary)
programme.desc: A documentary of the 1974 heavyweight championship bout in Zaire, 'The Rumble in the Jungle,' between champion George Foreman and underdog challenger Muhammad Ali.

programme.title: Hoop Dreams, (1994, Documentary)
programme.desc: A film following the lives of two inner-city Chicago boys who struggle to become college basketball players on the road to going professional.

programme.title: Grizzly Man, (2005, Documentary)
programme.desc: Werner Herzog (Cave of Forgotten Dreams) crafts a compelling documentary look at wildlife preservationist Timothy Treadwell, who lived unarmed among grizzly bears in Alaska.

programme.title: Philadelphia, (1993, Drama)
programme.desc: Hailed as a landmark film that dazzles with deep emotion and exceptional acting, PHILADELPHIA stars Tom Hanks and Denzel Washington as two competing lawyers who join forces to sue a prestigious law firm for AIDS discrimination. Rating: PG-13

programme.title: Primal Fear, (1995, Thriller)
programme.desc: Courtroom thriller about a slick, hotshot lawyer (Richard Gere) who takes the seemingly unwinnable case of a young altar boy (Edward Norton) accused of murdering an eminent catholic priest.

programme.title: Indecent Proposal, (1993, Romance)
programme.desc: Demi Moore and Woody Harrelson are Diana and David Murphy, a financially strapped couple who are betting on a quick trip to Las Vegas to deal them a lucky hand. But the odds are suddenly even more attractive when billionaire John Gage ups the ante.

programme.title: Fargo, (1996, Thriller)
programme.desc: Things go awry when car salesman Jerry Lundegaard (William H. Macy) hires two thugs to kidnap his wife. Soon, the very pregnant and chipper Police Chief Marge Gunderson (Frances McDormand) takes the case. Is she up for the challenge? You betcha.

programme.title: The Fisher King, (1991, Comedy)
programme.desc: Parry, a homeless history professor, lives in a fantasy world full of castles, Red Knights and damsels in distress. Bridges co-stars as Jack, New York's #1 shock deejay, whose off-hand arrogance triggers a tragedy which ruins his career. Rated: R

programme.title: Awakenings, (1990, Drama)
programme.desc: Robert De Niro and Robin Williams star in a story of the consequences of a maverick doctor's medical miracle. Rated: PG-13

programme.title: The Birdcage, (1996, Screwball)
programme.desc: Robin Williams, Gene Hackman, Nathan Lane and Dianne Wiest lead the laughs in this wild Comedy that insists you don't have to be a woman to be a mother.

programme.title: The Godfather, (1972, Drama)
programme.desc: A chilling portrait of the Corleone family's rise and near fall from power in America along with balancing the story of the Sicilian clan's ugly crime business in which they are engaged.

programme.title: The Godfather Part II, (1974, Drama)
programme.desc: The continuing saga of a young Vito Corleone growing up in Sicily and in New York during the 1910s and then following Michael Corleone in the 1950s as he tries to expand the family business.

programme.title: The Long Goodbye, (1973, Action)
programme.desc: Under the inimitable direction of Robert Altman, Elliot Gould stars as the laid-back, legendary private eye Philip Marlowe investigating a mysterious murder. Also stars Sterling Hayden and Nina Van Pallandt.

programme.title: The Godfather, (1972, Drama)
programme.desc: A chilling portrait of the Corleone family's rise and near fall from power in America along with balancing the story of the Sicilian clan's ugly crime business in which they are engaged.

programme.desc: The continuing saga of a young Vito Corleone growing up in Sicily and in New York during the 1910s and then following Michael Corleone in the 1950s as he tries to expand the family business.

programme.title: The Mechanic, (1972, Action)

programme.desc: As Marik's evil grows, Ishizu reveals the secrets of her bloodline: How did Marik transform from a kind child into a power-hungry tyrant out for world domination? Can Yugi save Marik from the edge of darkness, or is he already beyond salvation?

programme.sub-title: Showdown in the Shadows Part 2: Marik Vs. Bakura

programme.desc: Kaiba's blimp is hijacked by a mysterious boy named Noah and his henchmen - five familiar foes from Yugi and Kaiba's past who are out for revenge!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: The first to duel under the all-new Deck Master System is Yugi against Big 1 Gansley's Deepsea Warrior! Can Yugi master the complex new rules, or will the rules master him?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: As Yugi struggles to make heads or tails of the Deck Master System, Big 1 uses his Deck Master ability to send all of Yugi's attacks right back! How can Yugi defeat an opponent when his attacks take away his own life points?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Yugi's running out of life points, but can his cute little Deck Master Kuriboh unleash his furry fury to turn the tide of battle?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Prepare for a feathered fight when T√©a squares off against Big 2 Crump's Nightmare Penguin where the loser will be trapped forever in a block of ice!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: As T√©a's body turns more and more into a giant popsicle, can she keep her brain from freezing to find a way to melt Big 2's strategy? Or will Big 2's penguin horde waddle all over her?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey squares off against the judicial jerk Big 3 Johnson who takes the Deck Master form of Judge Man! How can Joey defeat a foe who can destroy Joey's monsters at will?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Just when Joey seems to gain the upper hand, he hits the longest streak of bad luck in the history of mankind! Has Joey's fortunes finally run out, or is a crooked judge ignoring the rules of the law?

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Big 4 Nezbitt challenges Duke, Tristan, and Serenity for the right to gain control of three bodies at once! Will Serenity's errors cost her team the ultimate price when Tristan and Duke can't cover for her mistakes?

programme.desc: One down, two to go! With the loss of Tristan, Serenity is heartbroken. Can she pull herself together and remember the lessons Tristan taught her to turn the duel around?

programme.desc: Tristan's back... but he's not who he appears to be when he kidnaps Mokuba! It's time for Kaiba to stop monkeying around and rescue his brother, but he's confronted by Big 5 Leichter!

programme.desc: Big 5's Satellite Cannon attacks Kaiba's monsters from deep space! Mokuba's unwavering faith in Kaiba inspires him to believe that his brother will pull out the victory, but Noah has plans to ruin their brotherhood...

programme.desc: Kaiba arrives at Noah's sanctuary to rescue Mokuba, but Mokuba wants to stay with Noah! Has Mokuba seen the evil within Kaiba, or is something more sinister in the works?

programme.desc: Noah gives the Big Five one last chance to redeem themselves in a five-on-two tag team duel where Yugi and Joey take on the entire Big Five!

programme.desc: The Big Five concentrate their attack on Joey so that Yugi would be forced to duel all alone! Outmanned and overpowered, Yugi and Joey are near the end of the line!

programme.desc: It's a duel for control of KaibaCorp when Noah squares off against Kaiba! But can Kaiba fight at full strength after he learns the hidden truth about Noah... and the tragic past that made him what he is today?

programme.desc: Noah's Shinato's Ark steals monsters into its keep to use as an impenetrable wall of servants! How can Kaiba hurt Noah when Noah has an endless stream of monsters to protect himself with?

programme.desc: Kaiba's about to finish Noah, but Mokuba protects Noah from his final blow! Will Kaiba sacrifice his beloved brother in exchange for freedom, or will the brotherly bond remain unbreakable?

programme.desc: For every turn that passes, one of Yugi's friends is transformed into stone! As more and more of his friends harden into solid rock, can Yugi defeat Noah before he runs out of turns and transforms into stone himself?

programme.desc: Yugi's friends are petrified into solid stone statues, but their spirits live on! Their combined souls energize Yugi into a noble fight, but is spirit going to win the duel when Yugi's not drawing the right cards?

programme.desc: Yugi has defeated Noah... but they still can't escape from the virtual world! The real reason behind their entrapment is revealed... as is the true villain pulling the strings!

programme.desc: As Kaiba squares off against his stepfather Gozaburo for their final battle, Yugi and friends are attacked by endless hordes of monsters! Their only hope is Noah, but they can't expect help from their enemy... can they?

programme.desc: Time is almost up before the missile's explosion destroys Yugi and friends! Will the Battle City finalists beat the clock and live to duel another day in the stunning conclusion to the virtual world saga!

programme.desc: Yugi and friends arrive at KaibaCorp Island where the Battle City finalists will compete in the ultimate dueling arena! Get ready for the awesome four-person battle royal where any duelist can attack anyone else!

programme.desc: Honor, friendship, revenge... As each duelist remembers what they're fighting for, the battle royal rages on where none of the duelists know where the next attack is going to come from!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Joey may have fought some of the fiercest fights in Battle City, but has all his training taught him to become an elite duelist? Joey's gonna show what he's made of in the conclusion to the four-man battle royal!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Marik ensnares Joey in a Shadow Game where each duelist's heart is linked with his monsters... literally! Every time a monster received damage, the duelist feels the pain instead!

programme.title: Yu-Gi-Oh!
programme.desc: Marik's Helpoemer send Joey's powerful cards to the graveyard before Joey can use them! Running low on cards and life points, Joey's opportunities for staging a comeback are nearly depleted!

programme.title: Se√±or Pink and Franky continue their knock-down, drag-out, manly fight. As both of them are pushed to their limits, we learn Se√±or's tragic past! Meanwhile, Princess Mansherry's rescue hits a snag as she stubbornly refuses to leave!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Manly Duel! Se√±or's Elegy of Love!

programme.title: Franky and Se√±or Pink end their harrowing duel in a manly way - but victory knocks the wind out of even the winner's sails! Meanwhile, Diamante and Kyros struggle desperately on the Sunflower Field, each demonstrating their extreme prowess.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Stardust of Death! Diamante's Storm of Vicious Attacks!

programme.title: Kyros, unbowed by Diamante's vicious attacks, fights back with the anger and retribution of all of Dressrosa in order to fulfill his promise to protect Rebecca. If he is successful, only a few executives will remain.
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: Pica loses his temper and turns his full wrath against King Riku, whom he hopes to destroy, ending the revolution against Doflamingo. Meanwhile, Zoro, who has been distracted by Pica and drawn far from the battle, has to hatch a plan to save the king!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Moving Across the Ground! The Giant Statue Pica's Surprise Maneuver!

programme.title: With the lives of King Riku, Usopp, and the others on the old King's Plateau in the balance, Zoro must dig deep and discover a powerful technique to counter Pica's near-unstoppable onslaught. Meanwhile, King Riku ponders what it means to be a good king.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A Decisive Battle in Midair! Zoro's New Special Secret Technique Blasts!

programme.title: Zoro finishes off Pica, and those below his crumbling body rush to find shelter. Meanwhile, the Tontattas finish up demolishing the SMILE Factory, and Luffy's hand is forced in his duel with Bellamy!
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: Taking down Bellamy only enrages Luffy in his fight against Doflamingo, his anger multiplying when he finds Law's lifeless body! Meanwhile, Doflamingo takes the next step to end the game he started, which will endanger everybody in Dressrosa!
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: The Birdcage draws tighter and tighter around Dressrosa, threatening to destroy all life on the island kingdom! Meanwhile, Doflamingo stands down Luffy for a final confrontation, but a surprising twist shocks everyone on the top of the Royal Palace!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A Blade of Tenacity! The Gamma Knife Counterattack!

programme.title: Law's attack proves powerful - but Doflamingo's power has depths which he and Luffy haven't bargained for. When Doflamingo makes his counterattack, Luffy stares him down with an amazing power.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A Collision of Haki! Luffy vs. Doflamingo!

programme.title: Trebol's wrath is fully inflamed as Law summons enough energy to speak, denouncing the Doflamingo Family executives as pawns in Doflamingo's game. But Law gathers enough energy to do more than just speak out.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Unassailable! The Stunning Secret of Trebol!

programme.title: Cavendish has to make a difficult decision when the severely wounded Law begs him to be left behind. Meanwhile, seeing even his Second Gear or Third Gear attacks aren't working against Doflamingo, Luffy decides to use his ultimate technique!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Anger Erupts! I Will Take Everything upon Myself!

programme.title: Luffy and Doflamingo duke it out while the Birdcage tightens its grip on Dressrosa! Zoro sets off with a plan to stop it from slicing apart the country, while Luffy's Fourth Gear proves quite potent against Doflamingo!
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: The Birdcage continues its merciless constriction, sending the residents of Dressrosa fleeing towards the center of the island, while King Riku calls out to his people: Survive long enough for Luffy to vanquish the last of the royal family.
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: Fourth Gear gives Luffy the power he needs to head off Doflamingo at every strike! But the energy required to keep Fourth Gear going starts to take a toll on Luffy. Will he have enough left to finish the job?
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: Bounce-man's power has drained Luffy, leaving him in need of a rest before he can reuse his Haki, but luckily the gladiators from the Colosseum have come around and are focusing on taking down Doflamingo! Sabo steps in at a crucial moment.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Flame Dragon King! Protect Luffy's Life!

programme.title: With Luffy and so many of the Straw Hats' allies incapacitated, victory seems inevitable for Doflamingo - but the compassion of Mansherry may be enough to turn the tide and renew their hope - to stop the Birdcage!
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: With just over a minute to spare, everyone in Dressrosa turns their efforts towards slowing down the Birdcage as it squeezes the life out of the country! Meanwhile, Viola seeks Doflamingo out herself, for a shocking confrontation!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: As Long as We Breathe! Stop the Deadly Birdcage!

programme.title: Only a bit more time remains before Luffy returns to the scene! But as time slips by, those who had been roused by Princess Mansherry's powers begin to falter! Meanwhile, Rebecca, under the control of Doflamingo, is about to attack Viola!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Dead or Alive! A Fateful Countdown!

programme.title: Luffy regains enough Haki to face off against Doflamingo, but his health is still poor. With the Birdcage closing in, is there a technique left in his repertoire that is strong enough to take down Doflamingo?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Attack on a Celestial! Luffy's King Kong Gun of Anger!

programme.title: With Doflamingo thoroughly quashed and the Birdcage collapsing, the people of Dressrosa shed tears of joy remembering the hardships they've endured, and the actions taken by Luffy and the others to free them.
programme.desc: One Piece

programme.title: Jesus Burgess of the Blackbeard Pirates tries to agitate Sabo, mocking Ace's final words in order to unsettle him enough that he can try to steal the Flare-Flare Fruit! Meanwhile, people of Dressrosa beg King Riku to resume the crown.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Unheard-of! Admiral Fujitora‚Äôs Surprising Decision!

programme.title: Repercussions of Doflamingo's defeat reverberate around the world! Fujitora's actions put the Navy in a tight spot, and the "Worst Generation" beings to stir into action!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Sending a Shock Wave! The Worst Generation Goes Into Action!

programme.title: The combatants in the battle for Dressrosa can finally begin to recoup, but those who stay awake are treated to the story of how Sabo joined the Revolutionary Army!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Birth of the Legend! The Adventures of the Revolutionary Warrior Sabo!

programme.title: Sabo recounts his surprising reunion with Luffy at the Colosseum as the Straw Hats and the others continue to recoup. Meanwhile, Fujitora gambles on how to make his next move - and the odds are in Luffy's favor!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Brothers' Bond! The Untold Story Behind Luffy and Sabo's Reunion!

programme.title: As Sabo departs, our attention shifts to the other Straw Hats waging a fierce battle on a mysterious island. And a new drama is set into motion as ill portents fall from the sky!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Strongest Creature! One of the Four Emperors - Kaido, King of the Beasts!

programme.title: As Luffy and the others begin to come to their senses, major players in the Navy arrive to search Dressrosa for the Straw Hats! Also, Rebecca's history is whitewashed with a fake cover story - but why?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Fujitora Takes Action! The Complete Siege of the Straw Hats!

programme.title: Fujitora's flirting with chance has turned out poorly for the Straw Hats as the full Navy force bears down on Dressrosa searching for the pirates! Luffy and the others make a mad dash for the east port to get off the island.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: A State of Emergency! Rebecca Is Kidnapped!

programme.title: Rebecca has precious little time to follow Luffy's lead and make it to Kyros. Can she make it in time? Meanwhile, Fujitora is closing in on Bartolomeo and the other Colosseum warriors while Trafalgar Law faces the shadows of his past!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Bond Between Father and Daughter! Kyros and Rebecca!

programme.title: Law and Sengoku share memories of Corazon, and the secret of Trafalgar Law's name. Meanwhile, Fujitora uses the destruction caused by the battle in Dressrosa as a weapon, and squares off one-on-one with Luffy!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Men's Pride! Luffy vs. Fujitora, Head-to-Head!

programme.title: The people of Dressrosa show their appreciation to the Straw Hats one last time by foiling Fujitora's strategy. As Luffy and the others are able to finally make their break from the island, however, an unbelievable new chapter opens in the story.
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: No Way Out! Admiral Fujitora's Ruthless Pursuit!

programme.title: With newfound allies won in the battle at Dressrosa, and as the Navy watches, Luffy and the Straw Hats depart Dressrosa for open water. But will Luffy accept the oath of allegiance given by his new fleet?
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: Sons' Cups! The Straw Hat Fleet is Formed!

programme.title: While the Straw Hats are underway, Doflamingo has serious predictions for the upset of the world order! Meanwhile, the recent actions in Dressrosa have led to surprising results!
programme.desc: One Piece
programme.sub-title: The Numerous Rivals Struggle Amongst Themselves! The Raging Monsters of the New World

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Lupin and friends go to have fun at the horse race track, but winning isn't as easy as stealing. Lupin notices two people who are winning big money hand over fist, and gets suspicious.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Catherine rescues Lupin and Jigen, who are pursued by Zenigata as usual. She's an old acquaintance of Jigen's, and provokes Jigen to steal a 140-karat diamond from her own mansion.

programme.desc: Wolf and Rose are a cool hitmen duo with the ambition of rising to the top of the hitman business by killing Lupin. They capture Goemon and torture him to confess about Lupin's weaknesses. Lupin learns that Goemon is in danger.

programme.desc: The chief of the police department accused of mismanagement on Lupin's release, hit the prime minister out of anger and was dismissed. Zenigata thinks that Lupin is the only arrest to avenge the chief's death, and starts an operation.

programme.desc: The Mona Lisa never leaves the Louvre Museum. Ars√®ne Lupin tried unsuccessfully to steal her and Lupin III wants her for his collection, however, and fireworks ignite between him and Zenigata in charge of security.

programme.desc: On New Years Eve, Lupin is after is the Golden Treasure Ship at Mount Horai. It's said that the Seven Lucky Gods conferred this treasure, which is shown in public only once a year when the New Year's bell rings at the belfry of Kohoji Temple.

programme.desc: Lupin finds a piece of paper in a silk hat, an heirloom of Ars√®ne Lupin. It's information regarding an opal statue of Venus, and since Lupin figures its ownership is his birthright, he heads to Gregoire's castle.

programme.title: Lupin the 3rd, Part 2
programme.desc: Zenigata acquires a pie-throwing gun, and is ordered to capture Lupin. Meanwhile, Lupin and Fujiko are discussing Napoleon's treasures. It's said that the key to solving the mystery of their whereabouts lies in a scarf made by Napoleon's assistant‚Ä¶

programme.title: Terminator: Dark Fate (2019)
programme.desc: Seasoned warrior Sarah Connor joins forces with a hybrid cyborg human and the T-800 model to protect a young woman from the Rev-9 -- a newly modified and seemingly indestructible liquid Terminator from the future.

programme.title: The Lincoln Lawyer (2011)
programme.desc: A lawyer (Matthew McConaughey) who operates out of the back of his Lincoln Continental lands the case of a lifetime when he defends a Beverly Hills playboy accused of attempted murder.

programme.title: Boogie Nights (1997)
programme.desc: A producer (Burt Reynolds) guides a young man (Mark Wahlberg) to success in the 1970s porn industry, but greed and egotism lead to his downfall in the 80s.

programme.title: Jackass Presents: Bad Grandpa (2013)
programme.desc: Irving Zisman (Johnny Knoxville) takes his young and impressionable grandson (Jackson Nicoll) on a cross-country trip in which they encounter male strippers, biker-bar patrons and other unsuspecting citizens.

programme.title: Jackass: The Movie (2002)
programme.desc: Nitwits (Johnny Knoxville, Bam Margera, Chris Pontius) perform outrageous stunts and pull practical jokes on an unsuspecting public.

programme.title: Jackass: Number Two (2006)
programme.desc: Daredevils go for the gross-out when they subject an unsuspecting public to more outrageous stunts and practical jokes.

programme.title: The Mist (2007)
programme.desc: Trapped townspeople (Thomas Jane, Marcia Gay Harden, Laurie Holden) face monsters inside and out after a supernatural fog engulfs their Maine community.

programme.title: Congo (1995)
programme.desc: Killer gorillas menace an ex-CIA agent (Laura Linney), a primatologist (Dylan Walsh) and others on a mission in Africa.

programme.title: Eagle Eye (2008)
programme.desc: Two strangers (Shia LaBeouf, Michelle Monaghan) become pawns of a mysterious woman who threatens their friends and family and uses technology to control their actions.

programme.title: Hide and Seek (2021)
programme.desc: When a wealthy businessman follows a lead to find his missing brother, he dives headlong into a twisted underworld of squatters and vagrants that threatens to tear apart his family as he struggles to maintain his sanity.

programme.title: The Girl on the Train (2016)
programme.desc: Rachel, who is devastated by her divorce, spends her commute fantasizing about the couple that lives in a house that her train passes. One morning, she sees something shocking and becomes entangled in a missing persons investigation.

programme.title: Faster (2010)
programme.desc: A veteran cop (Billy Bob Thornton) and an assassin (Oliver Jackson-Cohen) track an ex-convict (Dwayne Johnson) who is on a mission to take revenge on his brothers killers.

programme.title: Inglourious Basterds (2009)
programme.desc: An Allied officer (Brad Pitt) and his team of Jewish soldiers join forces with a German actress and undercover agent to take down the leaders of the Third Reich.

programme.title: Inglourious Basterds (2009)
programme.desc: An Allied officer (Brad Pitt) and his team of Jewish soldiers join forces with a German actress and undercover agent to take down the leaders of the Third Reich.

programme.title: The Untouchables (1987)
programme.desc: Though Prohibition agent Eliot Ness attempts to take Al Capone down, even his best efforts fail due to widespread corruption within the Windy Citys police force.

programme.title: The Comeback Trail (2020)
programme.desc: Indebted to a mobster, a desperate producer tries to "accidentally" kill an aging movie star for an insurance scam. However, he soon begins to realize that the film theyre shooting is a masterpiece in the making.

programme.title: Saving Private Ryan (1998)
programme.desc: A World War II captain (Tom Hanks) and his squad (Edward Burns, Tom Sizemore) risk all to locate and send home a soldier whose three brothers died in combat.

programme.title: Flags of Our Fathers (2006)
programme.desc: Some of the servicemen who raised the U.S. flag on Mount Suribachi during the Battle of Iwo Jima at the end of World War II live to hear of their status as heroes.

programme.title: Uncommon Valor (1983)
programme.desc: A colonel with a sponsor leads five Marine veterans into Laos to find his son and others missing in action.

programme.title: The Four Feathers (2002)
programme.desc: Accused of cowardice for resigning when assigned to a dangerous post, a former British soldier (Heath Ledger) tries to help his old regiment fight rebels in Africa.

programme.title: The Survivalist (2021)
programme.desc: A year and a half after the fall of civilization due to a viral outbreak, a former FBI agent is forced to protect a young woman immune to the disease from a dangerous gang leader hunting her.

programme.title: Marathon Man (1976)
programme.desc: The CIA and a Nazi death-camp dentist (Laurence Olivier) chase a New York graduate student (Dustin Hoffman).

programme.title: Downhill Racer (1969)
programme.desc: A cocky American (Robert Redford) skis and apres-skis Europe, training with his coach (Gene Hackman) for the Olympics.

programme.title: Black Rain (1989)
programme.desc: Two New York police detectives (Michael Douglas, Andy Garcia) take an underworld upstart back to Osaka, Japan.

programme.title: The Gunman (2015)
programme.desc: A former Special Forces soldier (Sean Penn) who has PTSD tries to reconnect with his longtime lover, but must first find out who wants him dead... and why.

programme.title: Judgment Night (1993)
programme.desc: On their way to a boxing match, four young men take a wrong turn in Chicago and find danger as witnesses to murder.

programme.title: Rules of Engagement (2000)
programme.desc: A decorated career Marine (Samuel L. Jackson), about to stand trial for a botched rescue mission, asks an old friend (Tommy Lee Jones) to defend him.

programme.title: Hit and Run (2012)
programme.desc: A former getaway driver (Dax Shepard) finds feds and his former gang members on his tail when he breaks out of the Witness Protection Program to help his girlfriend (Kristen Bell) get to Los Angeles.

programme.title: The Autopsy of Jane Doe (2016)
programme.desc: When father and son coroners investigate the death of a beautiful "Jane Doe," they find increasingly bizarre clues.

programme.title: Awake (2007)
programme.desc: A young man (Hayden Christensen) who is undergoing surgery experiences anesthesia awareness, which leaves him alert but paralyzed and unable to warn his doctors.

programme.title: The Fifth Estate (2013)
programme.desc: WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange (Benedict Cumberbatch) and his colleague, Daniel Domscheit-Berg (Daniel Bruhl), provide a platform for whistle-blowers to leak covert data anonymously and expose government secrets and corporate crimes.

programme.title: Texas Rangers (2001)
programme.desc: Young men (James Van Der Beek, Dylan McDermott, Usher Raymond) band together to stop a ruthless bandit from engineering raids on cattle ranchers.

programme.title: Alone in Berlin (2016)
programme.desc: A German couple lose their son in WWII, prompting them to become secretly anti-Nazi.

programme.title: Freedoms Path (2022)
programme.desc: When Union soldier William runs from battle, hes taken to safety by a heroic young Black man. Kitch is part of a secret community of freed slaves running a section of the Underground Railroad, but a desperate slave catcher is on their trail.

programme.title: The Score (2021)
programme.desc: Two small-time crooks drive to a secluded cafe for a big score.

programme.title: Bridge of Spies (2015)
programme.desc: During the Cold War, a CIA operative (Scott Shepherd) recruits New York lawyer James Donovan (Tom Hanks) to negotiate a prisoner exchange for captured U.S. pilot Francis Gary Powers (Austin Stowell).

programme.title: Black Lotus (2023)
programme.desc: A soldier uses his military training to rescue the kidnapped daughter of his dead friend.

programme.title: Warrior Strong (2023)
programme.desc: Trying to save his career, a suspended professional basketball player returns home to coach his former high school team.

programme.title: Allied (2016)
programme.desc: World War II operative Max Vatan (Brad Pitt) falls for French Resistance fighter Marianne Beausejour (Marion Cotillard) during a deadly mission behind enemy lines. Reunited in London, a devastating secret tests their love and loyalty to each other.

programme.title: The Last Castle (2001)
programme.desc: A court-martialed general (Robert Redford) leads a revolt against a corrupt warden (James Gandolfini) in a military prison.

programme.title: Bridge of Spies (2015)
programme.desc: During the Cold War, a CIA operative (Scott Shepherd) recruits New York lawyer James Donovan (Tom Hanks) to negotiate a prisoner exchange for captured U.S. pilot Francis Gary Powers (Austin Stowell).

programme.title: Camp X-Ray (2014)
programme.desc: A female guard (Kristen Stewart) at Guantanamo Bay forms an unlikely friendship with one of the facilitys longtime detainees.

programme.title: Hardcore Henry (2015)
programme.desc: A half-human, half-robotic hybrid embarks on a bloody rampage through Moscow to save his kidnapped wife (Haley Bennett) from a madman (Danila Kozlovsky) and his army of thugs.

programme.title: Mercy (2023)
programme.desc: An ex-military doctor finds herself in a fight for survival when the Irish mafia seizes control of the hospital at which she works. When her son is taken hostage, shes forced to rely on her battle-hardened past and lethal skills to save the day.

programme.title: On the Edge (2022)
programme.desc: A metro driver witnesses his son die and sets out to track down those who are responsible.

programme.title: American Selfie: One Nation Shoots Itself
programme.desc: Alexandra Pelosi captures a snapshot of America as the country faces a pandemic, a presidential election and a costly financial collapse.

programme.title: Eric Clapton: Life in 12 Bars (2017)
programme.desc: Eric Clapton is widely renowned as one of the greatest performers of all time. His isolated pursuit of his craft, and fear of selling out, served as a catalyst for his evolution as an artist.

programme.title: JFK Revisited: Through the Looking Glass (2021)
programme.sub-title: JFK Revisited: Through the Looking Glass (2021)
programme.desc: Filmmaker Oliver Stone examines the circumstances surrounding the assassination of President John F. Kennedy on Nov. 22, 1963, in Dallas.

programme.title: Black Noise (2023)
programme.desc: When an elite security team is sent to a remote island to rescue a VIP, their mission takes a turn as they are confronted by masked gunmen. To keep hold of their lives, the team must act quickly to assess the situation and escape the island.

programme.title: 6 Days (2017)
